abstract: Hollywood establishment is deeply skeptical about The Screening Room, venture headed by Prem Akkaraju and Napster co-founder Sean Parker that would make blockbuster movies available for home screening on day of release; theater owners in particular are worried, despite proposed rental and device fees and assurance of revenue sharing; only handful of powerful players, including AMC Entertainment, have voiced support.
lead_paragraph: The Screening Room, a start-up supported by AMC, wants consumers to pay $50 to rent big-budget movies on the same day they arrive in theaters.

headline.main: Hollywood Divided Over Movie Streaming Service
headline.print_headline: Plan to Stream Films on Day 1 Spurs Conflict

snippet: The Screening Room, a start-up supported by AMC, wants consumers to pay $50 to rent big-budget movies on the same day they arrive in theaters.
